title: EVendo Score for Esophageal Varices
description: Predicts presence and size of esophageal varices prior to screening endoscopy in patients with cirrhosis. Helps identify patients who may safely defer endoscopic screening.

parameters.name: ascites_present
parameters.description: Presence of ascites on imaging or clinical examination

result.name: evendo_score
result.description: EVendo Score calculated from laboratory values and clinical findings

ranges.interpretation: Screening endoscopy may be safely deferred. Probability of varices <5%. Sensitivity 95.1%, NPV 95.8%.
Endoscopic screening recommended. Probability of varices ≥5%. Consider urgent endoscopy if clinical suspicion high.

references: Dong TS, Kalani A, Aby ES, Le L, Luu K, Hauer M, et al. Machine Learning-based Development and Validation of a Scoring System for Screening High-Risk Esophageal Varices. Clin Gastroenterol Hepatol. 2019 Sep;17(10):1894-1901.e1. doi: 10.1016/j.cgh.2019.01.025.

Gibiino G, Garcovich M, Ainora ME, Zocco MA. Machine learning and artificial intelligence: applications in hepatology. World J Gastroenterol. 2021 Jul 21;27(27):4384-4402. doi: 10.3748/wjg.v27.i27.4384.

Hassan M, Hasan MW, Giordano A, Masud F, Bartoli A, Ahmad N. Validation of the EVendo score for the prediction of varices in cirrhotic patients. World J Hepatol. 2022 Feb 27;14(2):460-474. doi: 10.4254/wjh.v14.i2.460.
formula: A = (8.5 × INR) + (AST / 35), B = (Platelet count / 150) + (BUN / 20) + (Hemoglobin / 15), EVendo Score = (A / B) + 1 (if ascites present)
notes: Use in patients >18 years with known or suspected cirrhosis
Do not use in patients with overt GI bleeding or history of acute variceal hemorrhage
Score ≤3.90 would spare 30.5% of patients from endoscopy, missing only 2.8% of varices needing treatment
Developed using machine learning (random forest algorithm)
Validated across multiple medical centers with robust performance characteristics
